hypothesis_content.title: Negative Macro Catalyst Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and a negative macro catalyst triggers a sharp 1-hour drop of 3-5%, the subsequent 24-hour period will see amplified selling pressure (measured by cumulative negative delta volume) exceeding the initial drop by a factor of 1.5x, creating a short opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with positive funding suggest complacent long positioning. Negative macro catalysts trigger liquidations that cascade as leveraged positions unwind. The initial drop often underestimates the full liquidation cascade, especially when volatility has been low.
entry_conditions: Negative macro catalyst news headline (Fed, inflation, geopolitical)
Funding rates remain positive (indicating leveraged long positioning)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches -8% from entry OR cumulative negative delta volume reaches 2x initial drop volume
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of initial drop

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals see price recovery above the 61.8% Fib level within 6 hours OR negative delta volume fails to exceed 1.2x initial drop volume within 24 hours.
